Tihotapcu bodo sodili še enkrat
Višje sodišče je razveljavilo sodbo Mariu Lesjaku, ki so na zatožni klopi zaradi prevažanja ilegalcev.
01 Nov 2019, 20:07 by Oste Bakal



Obtoženega Lesjaka sta na prvo obravnavo pravosodna policista privedla iz bližnjega pripora. FOTO: Oste Bakal



Igorju Weindorferju, zagovorniku obtoženega, je uspelo s pritožbo in upa, da bo nova sankcija nižja. FOTO: Oste Bakal


MURSKA SOBOTA – Pred časom se je na okrožnem sodišču v Murski Soboti znašel 32-letni Mario Lesjak iz Slovenj Gradca, ki se je moral pred okrožnim sodnikom Stanislavom Jugom zagovarjati, ker junija ni upošteval ukazov policije, naj ustavi svoj avto. Policisti so namreč med varovanjem meje pri Razkrižju opazili, da na prednjem sedežu Lesjakovega avtomobila sedi Kitajka, in zaradi suma, da tihotapi prebežnike, se je patrulja pognala za njim.
Na predobravnavnem naroku je Lesjak sicer priznal krivdo, a je v svoj zagovor povedal, da je bil v kaznivo dejanje prisiljen.
Ko so ga le ustavili, so v njegovem avtomobilu našli štiri kitajske državljane, za prevoz katerih je obtoženi prejel najmanj 300 evrov po osebi, Lesjak pa je od takrat v priporu in tam naj bi počakal do pravnomočnosti sodbe, saj je bil kljub priznanju krivde obsojen na 14 mesecev zaporne kazni.


Igorju Weindorferju, zagovorniku obtoženega, je uspelo s pritožbo in upa, da bo nova sankcija nižja. FOTO: Oste Bakal

Zadeva pa se bo zdaj močno zavlekla, saj je senat Višjega sodišča v Mariboru prvostopenjsko sodbo razveljavil in mu naložil, naj se okrožno sodišče na glavni obravnavi opredeli do Lesjakovega zagovora, da naj bi bil v kaznivo dejanje prisiljen.
14mesecev zapora so mu dosodili v prvo.
Na predobravnavnem naroku je Lesjak priznal krivdo, a je v svoj zagovor povedal, da je bil v kaznivo dejanje prisiljen, ker je bil nekomu dolžan 1000 evrov, ta pa je denar zahteval nazaj, tudi z grožnjami. Odvetnik Igor Weindorfer je že na okrožnem sodišču sodniku Stanislavu Jugu predlagal, naj njegovega varovanca ne kaznuje tako strogo. »Ker v dogovorjenem času ni vrnil 1000 evrov, ki si jih je izposodil, sta do njegove hiše prišla dva moška. Odpeljala sta ga v gozd, kjer sta ga tepla in žgala z ognjem. Na voljo je imel 48 ur, da vrne denar, zato je bil primoran zaiti na stranpot,« ga je branil odvetnik Weindorfer, ki je to predstavil tudi višjim sodnikom, ti pa so naposled razveljavili prvostopenjsko sodbo in primer vrnili v razsojanje na okrožno sodišče, a pred drugega sodnika.Višje sodišče je soboškemu naložilo, naj opravi glavno obravnavo brez predobravnavnega naroka, na katerem je Lesjak krivdo že priznal.
text:
The smuggler will be tried again
The high court overturned the judgment of Mario Lesjak, who is on the bench for transporting illegals.
01 Nov 2019, 20:07 by Oste Bakal



The defendant Lesjak was taken into custody at the first reading by police officers. PHOTO: Oste Bakal



Igor Weindorfer, the defendant's advocate, succeeded with the appeal and hopes the new sanction will be lower. PHOTO: Oste Bakal


MURSKA SOBOTA - A long time ago, a 32-year-old Mario Lesjak from Slovenj Gradec found himself in Murska Sobota District Court, who had to plead before District Judge Stanislav Jug for failing to obey police orders in June to stop his car. Police officers noticed a Chinese man sitting in the front seat of Lesjak's car while guarding the border at Razkrižje, and on suspicion of smuggling the fugitives, a patrol ran after him.
At the pre-trial hearing, Lesjak admitted guilt, but said in his defense that he had been forced into the crime.
When he was stopped, four Chinese nationals were found in his car, for which the accused received at least 300 euros per person, and Lesjak has since been in custody and is expected to await the verdict until the verdict, despite being found guilty. to 14 months in prison.


Igor Weindorfer, the defendant's advocate, succeeded with the appeal and hopes the new sanction will be lower. PHOTO: Oste Bakal

The matter, however, will now be heavily delayed, as the Senate of the Higher Court in Maribor overturned the first-instance judgment, ordering the district court to decide in the trial at Lesjak's defense that he should be forced to commit the crime.
He was sentenced to 14 months in prison.
At a pre-trial hearing, Lesjak pleaded guilty but said in his defense that he had been forced into the crime because he was owed $ 1,000 to someone, who demanded the money back, even with threats. Attorney Igor Weindorfer has already suggested in District Court to Judge Stanislav Jug not to punish his client as severely. “Because he did not pay back the $ 1,000 he had borrowed in the agreed time, two men approached his house. They took him to the woods, where he was beaten and burned with fire. He had 48 hours to get the money back, so he had to go out of the way, "defended by lawyer Weindorfer, who also presented this to the higher judges, who subsequently overturned the first-instance judgment and remanded the case to district court. but before another judge. The High Court ordered the Soboski to hold a trial without a pre-trial hearing, at which Lesjak had already pleaded guilty.
